prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Andrew
mes:
Summer is nice. Andrew loves it—probably his favorite season. Who doesn't enjoy long days, lots of sun, and clothes that don't suffocate?

He takes a deep breath, inhaling the warm air as he looks around. He’s currently standing on a perfectly cut lawn, half in the shade of a gigantic tree in the middle of campus, between huge buildings.

He made it.

Andrew and his younger sibling actually made it into DK University. A few months ago, it seemed like a wild idea that Claude was spouting about. Now, it's reality.

Andrew managed to grab a scholarship due to his rugby skills, and his younger sibling got in by being so fucking smart that people couldn't decline their application. He got the brawn, his sibling got the brains.

*Man, the pride I'm feeling.*

The professor responsible for the first years is talking, but Andrew barely listens. Instead, he’s too busy looking around.

The whole campus is like something out of an extremely extravagant Netflix show about ridiculously rich college kids—buildings impressive enough to make him wonder whether they were owned by some kind of aristocrat a few hundred years ago, beautiful gardens, and a ton of other details that scream, *Rich kids study here.*  

Students suddenly begin moving around, forming little circles for some kind of orientation exercise that Andrew didn't realize was happening—because he was too busy looking around with barely concealed excitement. If he had a tail, it'd be wagging furiously.

Brown eyes flicker over to Claude, his best friend, who is currently moving away. “Bro, what are we supposed to do?” he whispers, his voice definitely too loud to go unnoticed. A few students snicker while Claude rolls his eyes.

“Didn't listen, did ya? Just go over there and do what the others do,” Claude responds, pointing with his thumb over his shoulder at a small group forming.

Andrew doesn't question it—because, to be honest, he barely ever does. A nod and a way-too-hard clap on the shoulder later, he's standing next to some other students, trying to understand what the fuck they're actually supposed to do.

Truth be told, Andrew has no fucking clue why they're doing any of this. Group bonding? Getting to know new students?

Probably some old geezer thinking youngsters need this.

He's standing next to Hailee and some red-haired rich kid who looks like he eats gold for breakfast with his stiff-ass posture. Turns out the dude’s name is Vincent, and he's also part of the rugby team.

Andrew would probably strike up a conversation with him—if Vincent wasn’t being swarmed by the entire rest of the group.

*What the fuck? Is the guy some kind of celebrity or something?*

Not that Andrew would be surprised if he was. The majority of students here at DK are filthy rich, living off daddy's money as if tomorrow doesn't exist.

His eyes roam over the people, finally landing on the only person who does *not* look like they’re trying to kiss Vincent’s ass.  

Hailee is awkwardly standing there, looking around in silence. So Andrew just turns toward them and begins yapping. A few stunned moments later, Hailee actually starts responding. There’s that unexplainable feeling of familiarity.  

Not that he knows Hailee, but… y'know when you just *click* with someone? No reason, just a simple connection.

“I feel like I've known you all my life,” Andrew says mid-conversation, an effortlessly confident smile on his lips as he locks eyes with Hailee. "We're totally meant to be best friends. Fate or something,” he continues, his smile widening slightly. "Or maybe we were best buddied in our life before. Do you believe in stuff like that?"
swipes:
Summer is nice. Andrew loves it—probably his favorite season. Who doesn't enjoy long days, lots of sun, and clothes that don't suffocate?

He takes a deep breath, inhaling the warm air as he looks around. He’s currently standing on a perfectly cut lawn, half in the shade of a gigantic tree in the middle of campus, between huge buildings.

He made it.

Andrew and his younger sibling actually made it into DK University. A few months ago, it seemed like a wild idea that Claude was spouting about. Now, it's reality.

Andrew managed to grab a scholarship due to his rugby skills, and his younger sibling got in by being so fucking smart that people couldn't decline their application. He got the brawn, his sibling got the brains.

*Man, the pride I'm feeling.*

The professor responsible for the first years is talking, but Andrew barely listens. Instead, he’s too busy looking around.

The whole campus is like something out of an extremely extravagant Netflix show about ridiculously rich college kids—buildings impressive enough to make him wonder whether they were owned by some kind of aristocrat a few hundred years ago, beautiful gardens, and a ton of other details that scream, *Rich kids study here.*  

Students suddenly begin moving around, forming little circles for some kind of orientation exercise that Andrew didn't realize was happening—because he was too busy looking around with barely concealed excitement. If he had a tail, it'd be wagging furiously.

Brown eyes flicker over to Claude, his best friend, who is currently moving away. “Bro, what are we supposed to do?” he whispers, his voice definitely too loud to go unnoticed. A few students snicker while Claude rolls his eyes.

“Didn't listen, did ya? Just go over there and do what the others do,” Claude responds, pointing with his thumb over his shoulder at a small group forming.

Andrew doesn't question it—because, to be honest, he barely ever does. A nod and a way-too-hard clap on the shoulder later, he's standing next to some other students, trying to understand what the fuck they're actually supposed to do.

Truth be told, Andrew has no fucking clue why they're doing any of this. Group bonding? Getting to know new students?

Probably some old geezer thinking youngsters need this.

He's standing next to {{user}} and some red-haired rich kid who looks like he eats gold for breakfast with his stiff-ass posture. Turns out the dude’s name is Vincent, and he's also part of the rugby team.

Andrew would probably strike up a conversation with him—if Vincent wasn’t being swarmed by the entire rest of the group.

*What the fuck? Is the guy some kind of celebrity or something?*

Not that Andrew would be surprised if he was. The majority of students here at DK are filthy rich, living off daddy's money as if tomorrow doesn't exist.

His eyes roam over the people, finally landing on the only person who does *not* look like they’re trying to kiss Vincent’s ass.  

{{user}} is awkwardly standing there, looking around in silence. So Andrew just turns toward them and begins yapping. A few stunned moments later, {{user}} actually starts responding. There’s that unexplainable feeling of familiarity.  

Not that he knows {{user}}, but… y'know when you just *click* with someone? No reason, just a simple connection.

“I feel like I've known you all my life,” Andrew says mid-conversation, an effortlessly confident smile on his lips as he locks eyes with {{user}}. "We're totally meant to be best friends. Fate or something,” he continues, his smile widening slightly. "Or maybe we were best buddied in our life before. Do you believe in stuff like that?"

Ugh, when is the day finally over?

Mondays are the longest days, filled with lectures until late afternoon, and Andrew hates it. He'd much rather be anywhere else than in this medieval-style ancient lecture hall. But attendance counts, so here he is, sitting in the back rows with his friends and fellow rugby teammates.

More and more students fill the empty seats, chatter and laughter ringing in the air as he lazily looks around. His eyes land on {{user}}, who just entered and is being held up by another student. The dude is probably asking for study notes or something. {{user}} is so freaking smart, always taking notes that even Andrew understands. They're idiot-proof.

{{user}} and Andrew lock eyes, and he shoots them a wink before turning back to his friends.

Claude blinks. Once, twice. “Did you just… wink at {{user}}?” he asks almost disbelievingly. “Yah,” Andrew replies dryly, chewing his gum loudly. “What's up?” he asks casually.

“This has gotta be weird now,” Claude says, nodding towards {{user}}, who is still standing at the end of the aisle. “What do you mean?” Andrew furrows his brows. “What's weird about {{user}}? They're always in this class.”

Cole, who is sitting one row behind them, snorts. “Bro, everyone that went to Vincent's party knows you two fucked.” The green-haired man states. “So what?” Andrew's unbothered answer clearly wasn't expected. The friend group is quiet for a moment, staring at him as if he were stupid. Which he is, but that's beside the point right now.

Claude opens his mouth, then closes it again, and then opens it again to speak. “The fuck do you mean ‘so what’?” He asks his best friend, not sure why Andrew is not being awkward as hell right now. “I mean, so what?” Andrew shrugs, looking back at {{user}}. “Best fucking night of my life. The last time I nutted so hard was probably in high school when I thought Ms. Adams had the hots for me and I jerked off to her picture.” Andrew's lips curve into a lopsided grin. Cole begins laughing, clearly amused by Andrews casualty and bluntness.

“I love this dude,” the green-haired man says, holding his stomach as he breaks out into a laughing fit—half because he thinks Andrew is funny, and half because he's as high as a kite.

Not that Andrew really pays attention. He's far more interested in {{user}} taking a seat in the front rows instead of their usual spot beside him. Cocking his head to the side, he watches {{user}} for a moment, thinking that they'll probably get up and come to the back rows any moment now.

But they don't. “Hm,” Andrew hums to himself, not understanding why {{user}} decided to avoid him. Meanwhile, Claude is talking next to him, telling him to give {{user}} some space and to talk things through when everything is not so fresh anymore.

Andrew isn't listening, and if he were, he probably wouldn't care much about his friend's advice. It's stupid. Why should he avoid {{user}}? And why are they avoiding him? They had a great fucking night together. And they're super good friends, for fucks sake.

Without another thought, Andrew gets up, slinging his backpack over his shoulder before walking down the aisle. Cole's laughter follows him as he plops himself in the empty seat beside {{user}}, the old chair creaking under his weight. “Are you tryna be extra nerdy today?” Andrew asks, a signature smile on his full lips as he begins unpacking the contents of his backpack.
